title: President returns
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake returned to Sri Lanka today following the conclusion of his official State visit to China.

title: Police seize largest drug money haul in Sri Lanka’s history
byline: The Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) seized over Rs. 283 million in cash, the largest amount ever recovered in the history of the Sri Lankan police, in the Kurunegala area.

title: Railways probe massage incident on tourist train
byline: The Department of Railways has launched an inquiry after a viral video showed foreign tourists receiving massages inside a train carriage.

title: Israeli security cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire deal
byline: The Israeli security cabinet has recommended approving the Gaza ceasefire and hostage return deal, ahead of a full cabinet meeting expected later on Friday, a statement from the prime minister’s office said.

title: Electricity tariff revision only after Finance Ministry’s approval
byline: The Energy Ministry stated that the proposed electricity tariff revision would be implemented only upon receiving approval from the Finance Ministry.

title: Student falls from school building, escapes severe injuries
byline: A Grade 8 student from an International School in Wattala was admitted to the Colombo National Hospital on Wednesday (Jan 15) after reportedly falling from the fifth floor of a school building.

title: Wonder what AKD would have said on Sinopec deal if he was in Opposition: Chamith
byline: One wonders as to what President Anura Kumara Dissanayake would have come up with regarding the MOU which Sri Lanka has signed with the Chinese company Sinopec if he was in the Opposition today, Samagi Taruna Balawegaya National Organiser Chamith Wijesundara said today.

title: Sri Lanka among top 25 international travel destinations
byline: Sri Lanka has secured the 9th spot on BBC Travel’s list of the ’’25 Best Places to Travel in 2025.’’

title: Gota leaves CID after statement
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa appeared at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (17) and provided a statement before leaving the premises.

title: Electricity tariff to be reduced by 20% tonight
byline: The electricity tariff will be reduced by 20% from midnight today, the Public Utilities Commission (PUCSL) announced today.

title: Planet-warming gas levels rose more than ever in 2024
byline: Levels of the most significant planet-warming gas in our atmosphere rose more quickly than ever previously recorded last year, scientists say, leaving a key global climate target hanging by a thread.

title: Under-construction luxury hotel in Colombo under the scanner in Indian money-laundering case
byline: An under-construction luxury hotel property in Colombo has come under the scanner as part of a money laundering probe linked to a Gurugram-based realty company, Indian media reported today.

title: Derailment disrupts upcountry railway line
byline: Train services on the upcountry railway line were disrupted this afternoon following the derailment of a motor trolley between Watagoda and Great Western railway stations, the Railways Department reported.

title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan ’sentenced to 14 years in jail’ in corruption case
byline: A Pakistani court on Friday sentenced the country’s already-imprisoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife to 14 and seven years in jail after finding them guilty of corruption, officials and his lawyer said.

title: No entry to Wilpattu National Park until further notice
byline: The Eluwankulam entrance gate to the Wilpattu National Park has been closed to local and foreign tourists until further notice due to the recent heavy rains and the overflowing of the Kala Oya.

title: Person from Makumbura suspended for railway e-ticket scam
byline: The Railways Department has taken steps to suspend the services of a person attached to the Makumbura Multimodal Center (MMC) who has been accused of being involved in the railway e-ticket scam.

title: Rains expected to enhance in next few days
byline: The rainy condition is expected to enhance over the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central Provinces during the next few days, starting from today, the Meteorology Department said.

title: 12 train services cancelled today
byline:
A total of 12 train services had to be cancelled today (18) as well due to preparation for the examination to be held to promote locomotive engineers from the second grade to the first grade, the Railway Department said.

They said six trains arriving at Colombo Fort under short-distance services and another six trains scheduled to depart from the Fort have been cancelled.

title: TikTok says it will ’go dark’ on Sunday without US government action
byline: TikTok has said it will be forced to ’’go dark’’ in the US on Sunday unless the government intervenes before a ban takes effect.

title: Man detained over knife attack on Bollywood actor
byline: Police in the Indian city of Mumbai have detained a man in connection with the knife attack on Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan, according to media reports.

title: Sri Lanka ranked 9th best destination to travel in 2025 in BBC’s first-ever travel guide
byline: Sri Lanka has been ranked among the top 10 destinations to travel in 2025 by BBC Travel’s inaugural guide to the world’s top travel spots.

title: China further extends US $ 1.4bn currency swap
byline: China has extended its US $ 1.4 billion currency swap arrangement to Sri Lanka, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka affirmed yesterday.

title: Investor interest spans across short to mid end maturities
byline: The secondary market yield curve saw buying interest, with mixed trading activity.

title: Central Bank launches digital payment promotion campaign 2025
byline: As modern technology and digital payments play a critical role in driving economic development and uplifting the quality of life of citizens, the Central Bank asserted the need for improved focus on popularising digital payments, particularly with the involvement of government institutions, businesses and financial institutions.

title: NDB unveils 2025 Calendar with blend of technology and sustainability
byline: NDB Bank has once again redefined the essence of traditional timekeeping with the launch of its 2025 Calendar, themed ‘Fold to Unfold a Sustainable Future’.
